intro: Anagallis arvensis var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are showy, with five petals that are often pink or red, and they bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
